ygData.subject: Neo Beast Wars

(The guy who was calling out the dinosaurs, Terrorsaur isn't on-line yet. 
I'm paciently waiting for the pod to come.)


Cheetor:




He awoke slowly, thinking briefly that he'd only fell asleep in his 
quarters, where he'd be safe when he awoke, where someone would tell him he 
was alright. When he thought there would be other bots around, he was all 
alone. He focused his optics on his ambient, sensing he was here before. 
There were familiar scents. He opened his glowing yellow optics to a lush, 
green envionment.

He gasped and jerked up. "Leaping lazers!" he exclaimed. He jumped to his 
feet, looking into the sky, past the tree tops. He looked desperatly for a 
moon. By the Matrix, was he back on Earth?

He looked down on himself to check for damage, and while he did so--

Cheetor froze, surprised. "What the..." He was back in his pre-tranmetal 
form. The way he had been when he first arrive here with his comrades.

Cheetor tried to make sense of this. He held his head and turned his body. 
He thought back. Something had hit him, on his way here. He had hit a 
wormhole, just like the Axalon did. But there was something more. It was 
like energon. Or was it? Cheetor tried to make sense of it.

He ran to the edge of the forest, where close-by was a blue lake. A fuzz of 
a memory came back. He remembered slamming his fighter ship into the lake 
after he lost control over the surge. It was underwater now, Primus curse 
his hide.

He looked up, searching again for the moon. He didn't see it, with the trees 
in the way. He shielded his optics with his hand. He would have to do 
something about this mess, maybe find a way to get back to Cybertron, get 
back to Optimus and tell him he was alright.

He looked around, remembering the last day on Earth--or so he thought it 
was. He was alone. All alone. Everyone execpt, Megatron, Blackarachnia, 
Optimus, Rattrap, Rhinox, Silverbolt, and himself died. Oh Primus, he would 
have to deal with the fact that he had to relive those moments. He lowered 
his head, thinking how was he going to deal with this? How was he going to 
get back home? He was alone. All alone, with no one to help.

Wait. Wait! It had to be a dream. Yes, a dream. He paused before he thought 
of how to do the test. He slowly approached a tree and studied it. He put 
his hand against it, feeling the ridgedness of the bark. Okay, he felt that. 
And it felt real. He took a breath. Last test. Pain test. In dreams, as he 
heard, you can't feel pain in dreams, so he tried it. He thumped his head 
against the trunk of the tree. His eyes flashed open widely as he felt the 
pain hit his forhead.

"Ow." He backed away. "All right, it's not a dream. I'm really back on 
Earth." He mused, then stamped his foot. "Oh, this sucks! What am I gonna 
do?" He sat down by the shore of the lake, staring at the glimmering waters. 
"I'm stranded on Earth, with no shelter and no back up. What a way to go." 
He propped his elbows on his knees, shaking his head.
